Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever stayed..”
Reviews.Author: Yuki Y
Reviews.Content: It's the worst hotel we've ever seen...it doesn't worth the price at all...there's not enough facility in the room, and our room has only one socket, which is installed on the ceiling...the room is also dirty, especially the beddings and it makes us itchy..moreover, there's even blood stain on towels and curtains...(probably due to all those mosquitoes...) plus, the hotel has the most impolite and least helpful staff we've ever met...the room is noisy as well as it is next to the shared bathroom outside...the only good thing about the hotel is the location, which is close to the rail station...

Reviews.Title: “Minimal at Best”
Reviews.Author: plywood12
Reviews.Content: The best thing this hotel has going for it is the closeness to the train station. The rooms are bare bone with no TV. The wifi does not work in the rooms. I was charged for a night when I could not get to Venice because the trains were shutdown due to a station fire. The breakfast matched the rooms--bare bone. It was one of my poorer rooms on our two month trip.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay for budget travelers”
Reviews.Author: murko06
Reviews.Content: Close to the train station, good breakfast, and affordable rates.

Reviews.Title: “A must - Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Mattoboy
Reviews.Content: Our room was lovely over looking the Piazza, The double glazing kept the noise out. A/C kept us cool. Walking distance to the train station. Breakfast was great more than expected.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to the train station”
Reviews.Author: JillPDrysdale
Reviews.Content: This hotel had been recommended by a friend and I was not disappointed. It is really convenient to the train station and this is so advantageous when you are dragging bags along cobbled streets! The man who checked us in was very courteous and helpful. Our room was at the top level - it was small and compact but clean. The breakfast is in a quaint wood panelled room and was quite a good variety. Overall, I thought this hotel was good value for money in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Best bang for your buck and close to the train station”
Reviews.Author: RandyRedd
Reviews.Content: For a budget traveller, especially a backpacker, this is the place to stay. It is a 10 minute easy walk from the train station, very reasonably priced (for Venice standards) and it's continental breakfast was one of the better that we experienced in Italy for budget priced properties. The room was not very big, had two single beds, but it was clean and had running water (private sink). We had to share a bathroom with the other rooms on our floor, but this never seemed to be a problem, it was always fairly clean, but I guess that could change based on who your sharing the hotel with. The front end staff were always nice, I always appreciate that beyond belief when I stay somewhere, just makes a place feel a whole lot cozier and comforting. An obvious downside of this place is also the upside I mentioned before, being close to the train station means you are far from the heart of Venice. Now by far I mean only a kilometre or two, but a kilometre or two in Venice's maze for streets means it can be very hard to navigate if you are not a local! This is fine during the day, but if you would like to enjoy Piazza San Marco by night then your navigation back may not only be a little hard but may seem a little scary! But really, I would HATE to carry my bags to one of the hotels in more central Venice, and I am not a big fan on having to pay more than I have too so I wouldn't have opted in for renting a water Taxi. The only reason this was not given a 5 star rating is because I would have preferred a room with a double or queen sized bed, and for that it seems you need to pay big bucks! P.S. One full day was enough for me in Venice, but I would recommend to most to stay for 2 days so you can enjoy the morning, afternoon and night atmospheres!

Reviews.Title: “Charming and convenient place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: mayfsi
Reviews.Content: Hotel Guerrini is located a very short walk (less than 5 mins.) away from the Santa Lucia Railway Station and the vaporetto stop in front of it. As soon as you emerge from the railway station, you just turn left and walk past Chieza degli Scalzi (a small church with a beautiful facade), various shops and trattorias/pizzerias. The staff is very kind and patient and speaks good English. There is free coffee up to a certain time of the day (after which you pay a small fee -- but who hangs around in the hotel drinking coffee anyway when you are in Venice?). Breakfast is made up of delicious croissants and rolls, yogurt, milk, juice, cereal, etc. Note however that there is no lift, so if you are carrying heavy bags, request that you be put in one of the rooms in the second floor. I was assigned a room in the third floor, so I just left my heavy bag in the luggage area beside the front desk and just took what I needed. The luggage area is quite safe, but don't forget to lock your bag anyway. There is also Wi-Fi in the hotel, but the signal is quite weak in the upper floors. The rooms are simple but quaint, comfortable and clean. The bathrooms are very clean as well. However, the walls are quite thin, so if you have the bad luck of staying in a room beside one occupied by a rambunctious family and you are a light sleeper, then you probably won't get a lot of sleep.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: McCubbins
Reviews.Content: We got off the overnight train from Paris at 9:33 and arrived at the Hotel at about 9:55 and our room was ready! It was a beautiful and spacious room. Breakfast in the morning is wonderful. It is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good value, located close to a station”
Reviews.Author: geneva11
Reviews.Content: Very close to a train station ( 3 min walk). Located on the tiny street of busy street, with 2 tables +chairs in front. Big advantage for hotel in that price range. Rooms not new but decent. Front desk personal is very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and good”
Reviews.Author: Trip4Mi
Reviews.Content: When we booked the hotel, we didn't expect much since it was listed as a two star hotel. It turned out to be quite nice. Our room is in the building across the main one that the front desk is located. The room is spacious and clean. Furniture is old, but with charm. It is very conveniently located (5 minutes walk to the train station and right off the main road in that part of the town). The breakfast is included, but is very basic. The staffs are nice. We really enjoyed our stay. One problem we had was the mosquito. There is a window in the bathroom that kept popping open. The housekeeper sometime left the window open also. Mosquito must have entered the room through those windows. We saw dead mosquito on the wall, probably killed by the previous guests. Every evening, we had to kill all the mosquito before going to bed. Overall I think it is a pretty good hotel. I would rate it between average and very good if there is such a choice.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel nice room”
Reviews.Author: Whoyou222
Reviews.Content: Nice room and it's close to the station. I'd advise a person to get a hotel close to the station because there are no cars allowed in Venice. I saw too many people walking a crapload with all of their luggage to get to their hotel. So this hotel was great. It was 5 minutes away from the train station and 8 minutes from the buses. No elevator just stairs, but not many floors anyways. Great price great location and they had a restaruant. The hotel is just a smidge off the main drag so you don't hear the foot traffic which was great. Plus free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, very close to Central station and shopping area”
Reviews.Author: Junsurya
Reviews.Content: just 4 minutes walks to the Central station very close to restaurants and various shops spacious room No elevator decent breakfast one hotel staff ( a bald man), his english is poor enough and must learn to smile a lot

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel, no frills”
Reviews.Author: Polpi_viaggiatori
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in December, before Christmas. There were very few tourists around and the price was a very good deal. The biggest strength of the hotel is the location: 5 minutes by walk from the railway station. Service is not excellent though: breakfast starts at 8 AM, quite modest for quantity and quality. We weren't able to change the heating level.

Reviews.Title: “Disastrous”
Reviews.Author: eriyue
Reviews.Content: It was raining in the night and when I got up, I felt my blanket wet and to find out that somehow rain water slipped in and my only pair of jeans left on the floor got soaking wet. told the recept and he just smiled as though he knew the problem. cheap but not recommended

Reviews.Title: “Clean, basic hotel close to station with great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: femme246
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel to be very close to the train station since we were only staying one night. It is about a 5 minute walk from the train station. (Come out of station, turn left, walk for about 5 minutes and turn left on Cannaregio) The hotel was very clean, basic and pretty much is what it's website describes. Rooms could definitely use a layer of paint. There was unlimited hot water, which was great because the hotel in Paris did not have even warm water for more than 2 minutes max. The room was very quiet and airconditioned. The bed is hard, but so are most of the beds we had in other cities. There is no wifi here. Breakfast was very good. There were 2 different cereals, granola, milk, juice, croissants, Nutella, hot drink machine, yogurt and a few other things. I was impressed with the breakfast. They held our bags for us when we checked out so we did not have to lug them around (held our bags means they put them in the corner with everyone else's bags that are being held). The only complaint really was that the hotel staff (not the front desk but the ladies who clean the place) look like they hated us and made us feel unwelcome. I dont think they meant to do it, just an observation. Overall, our stay was good.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is okay for 2 star. Location not...”
Reviews.Author: Westwingjack
Reviews.Content: Hotel is okay for 2 star. Location not far fron vaporetto stop andÂ main train station. Also near main square and road for groceries and restaurants.Â  Cleaniness of general hotel was fair. Shared bathroom and toilet was always in a hygenic condition but our bedroom ceiling and wall was covered in the splattered remains of squashed Mosquitos. Breakfast was fairly basic pasteries, edible but missable if you fancied Â a lie-in. Staff were pleasant and courteous. Best thing about the place overall was the location. Near the main attractions but not to central. Worth it if you intend to explore venice but don't stay if you are after comfortable amenities in your hotel.Â

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy the canal at your doorstep”
Reviews.Author: daudratul
Reviews.Content: Hotel Guerini provides the location to get a gondola at your convenience. I call venice the drawing room of Europe and i felt the hotel is situated like a sofa. The shops for souvenir and food are just around the hotel. There is also a money exchange nearby (if you shop crazy and run out of cash..lol) so you can always explore street stalls around your hotel. Walking towards Piazza San Marco could be an experience from the hotel. You will always see the tomb but will get you sometime to reach there, the multilingual staffs of the hotel can definitely be a help (though not much because of the city streets of venice). The rooms will provide you the aesthetics of the ancient venice rooms. The classic furnitures with modern amenities are good match. The beds are comfortable enough to give you a good sleep after spending the whole day like either marcopolo, or if you choose like Casanova. :P

Reviews.Title: “Good value in a convenient, quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Tifosadelgiro
Reviews.Content: Great place if you're looking to stay relatively near the train station without a lot of noise. Clean room with a ceiling fan, air conditioning and private bath, even though it was listed as an economy room. Staff was courteous and helpful. Breakfast was more than adequate, with the usual array of breads, spreads, pastries, cereal, and coffee/espresso machine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: TravellerLimerick
Reviews.Content: Hotel Guerrini is in an excellent location just 5 minutes from the train station or one stop on the Vaporetto from the bus stop. It is really easy to find and for a 2 star I must say I was impressed. The man at reception was helpful and friendly and had no hesitation on showing me around as we were sharing a bathroom as our room was not ensuite. I booked a double room with a shared bathroom to save money. I was anxious about doing this but it was no problem during our 3 night stay as I donâ€™t think that anyone else was actually using the bathroom anyway only us. Both the room and the bathroom were clean and serviced each day and the bedroom was nicely decorated. The breakfast consisted of coffee, cheese and bread which was nice and light and the coffee was excellent. Overall this hotel served our purpose exactly and I would recommend this hotel to other visitors

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and clean but no air con”
Reviews.Author: Siperianunikko
Reviews.Content: My room was in 3rd floor with no air condition. It was in daytime + 40 outside and inside +30, so it was still so hot in the evening/night that you could'n really sleep. Otherwise the room was nice: good beds, sink in the room, clean linen and towels. Shower and toilet was in the corridor. Nice staff and breakfast was bearable; cheese, croissants, biscuits etc. (but all wrapped in plastic). Location is really good if you arrive by train.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Value!”
Reviews.Author: olugnufam
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in December. The hotel is conveniently located steps away from the train station and is hidden in a cove but is easy to find. There are bars, restaurants, deli's and other shops right outside of the hotel. The staff was extremely hospitable and the hotel was very clean. The rooms are average, but for a 2 star hotel the overall value is great. The breakfast spread was ok but seemed a bit lacking compared to some of the other hotels we stayed at in Italy during our stay. We stayed in a "shared bathroom accomodation" and didn't find that a problem at all. My only other complaint would be that you can hear a lot of outside noise - not really a problem for us - but if you want complete quiet at night i wouldn't recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Quaint Hotel”
Reviews.Author: donners30
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay in Venice at the Hotel Guerrini. Our stay was wonderful, the room was very pretty, just as presented on their website. It was a bit hard to find - but then again everything in Venice is. We did go past the hotel and asked a Restaurant owner who was more than happy to direct us to the hotel. The staff were very friendly, breakfast was rolls, coffee, nutella, jam, pastries and orange juice - enough for us. The hotel itself was very quiet - our window opened onto a cute courtyard. There is no TV as stated in other reviews, but you're in Venice - who needs a TV. If I wanted to watch TV - I'd stay home. Besides - it would all be in Italian... Definitely would recommend this hotel to anyone. It is the best deal that we could find in Venice - location to the Santa Lucia train station is very convenient - a 5-10 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “homey”
Reviews.Author: ponponpon
Reviews.Content: It was one of the best hotels I have stayed in. The only problem was that the breakfast was not satisfying. The receptionists were a little bit indifferent. We shared bathroom with other people and the toilets don't have a wash basin so after you're done, you'll ust have to go to your room to clean up. Other than that, the rooms were big, clean and comely. I definetly recommend this hotel if you don't expect too much.

Reviews.Title: “dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: SomeUglyDutchWoman
Reviews.Content: Clean but...the terrible closet one per twoo rooms makes horrible noises, specially in the middle of the night... They really wouldn't call the thing what they offer in the morning a breakfast...Some sweet peaces of bread, that almoast nowbody have eaten... I would never stay there again and wouldn't advice this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and friendly - real value for money!”
Reviews.Author: xy1234567
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Guerrini one week in 2001 and we loved it! The staff was very friendly and helpful, the room basic, but clean - no TV, but who needs one in this romantic city??? Coming back from a quiet night walk over bridges and along small alleyways, from a small wine bar or cafe, a TV would have been a nuisance. We were in fact glad there wasnÂ´t one... The bathroom was also very clean and everything in working order. The breakfast tasted very good: great coffee, wonderful Danish pastries and the usual rolls, butter and jam were more than enough to start a new day of sightseeing. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Basic and Inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: SoFLTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night in June, 2004. It is a very simple tourist class hotel and fairly inexpensive for Venice. It is located just a 4 minute walk from the train station, (no bridges). My room was very basic with a bed, a chair, a small desk and a nightstand. There was a large closet, but there was no TV or air conditioning. My room overlooked a noisy piazza. My room had a small bathroom with a stall shower that lacked a shower curtain. Other rooms have no facilities and share them down the hall. There is no elevator and breakfast was very basic with coffee and a plate that contained two rolls, (one hard, one soft), cheese, jam and butter. The staff was very helpful when the airline lost my luggage. There are dozens of places to eat and shop, as well as an inexpensive internet cafe on the street in front of the hotel or within 200 feet. I probably would not stay here again because it was so basic. If you want a comfortable place in Venice it is going to cost more then 85 euros.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Guerrini
HotelInfo.Address: Cannaregio 265, 30121 Venice, Italy
